‘Toy Story 4’ tops box office but underdelivers for Disney as 'Child’s Play’ takes second

Disney had to settle for just $118 with Toy Story 4 this weekend topping the box office charts while Childs Play reboot took second.

blog.name: fortheloveoffanfic
blog.title: For the love of Fanfic
blog.description: Welcome! Very new to Tumblr, still figuring things out. This blog will be/ is dedicated to fanfic. I love wriring, so you know, I do, a lot. Very open to taking requests. And that's all.

title: Latte
body:
(This is my first fic on here so forgive is done incorrectly)

Keanu Reeves x Reader

The coffee shop was busy, it usually was. They had the best brew on the block, better than all of those popular chain outlets. Busy or not, Keanu knew that he wasn’t going anywhere else, he didn’t really have any where to be soon, so he wasn’t in a hurry. He pushed open the door, joining the back of the long line. The aroma of fresh coffee filled the air and all around there was people, both standing and at tables, either chatting or staring at their devices. Even he had found himself on his phone as the line moved along slowly. He wasn’t really focusing on everyone around him until he noticed the couple in front of him murmuring and giggling. “ Its not. It can’t be.” The guy spoke in a hushed tone.

“It is. Look, I’m telling you. What are the odd that there are two celebrities in here.” She squealed quietly. “I want to talk to both of them,” She grasped her boyfriend’s arm. Two celebrities? What were they talking about? It was definitely unlike him, but he tore his gaze away from his phone and scanned the room, searching for a familiar face. It took a while but he eventually he did spot one. A woman, sitting at a table in the corner. She was working on her laptop, not paying any mind to her surroundings. Keanu didn’t know her personally, but he knew of her, he had seen her on the internet and on the back of a few of his favorite books. Y/n Y/L/N.

As the line moved forward, he watched as a few people went up to her, and each time, she stopped her work, giving them her full attention, engaging with them like they were all old friends. Fans came up to him too, and he treated them the same, taking pictures when they asked and even signing things.

Finally, he reached the counter and gave his order to a very nervous barista who asked him to sign her cap after. He did. Not long after, he got his drink, a mocha latte. Now was his chance. He began walking to her table. The closer he got, the more excited he became. She was just sitting there, here fingers dancing across the keyboard, occasionally taking a sip from her mug. Her glasses rested on the bridge of her nose and a few stray strands of hair fell in her face. She was beautiful, the pictures he had seen of her were great, but seeing her like this, he realized that they barely did her justice.

When he reached her table, she looked up before he could announce himself. She sucked in a breath, mouth slightly agape and eyes wide. She was a writer, she knew a lot of words, but in that moment, she forgot most of them. “You’re…you’re,” That was it, that was all the words she remembered.

Keanu laughed, running a hand through his long dark hair, “Yeah…and you’re you…” Really, that was the best you could do? He asked himself.

“Sit!” She blurted out suddenly. “I mean have a seat. If you want to. You don’t have to though.” Y/n cleared her throat, ready to have a go at attempt number three, “Would you like to sit?” Her celebrity crush had just strolled up to her at her favorite coffee shop and it was safe to say that she had been reduced to a star-struck mess. 

“I’d love to.” As soon as the words made a hurry exit off his lips, Keanu hated himself for sounding so eager. Mentally yelling at himself to get his shit together, he pulled out the empty chair and sat across from her. Y/n closed down her laptop and removed her glasses, securing them at the neck of her blouse. “I love your work by the way. I’ve read most of your books.”

She blushed, tucking her y/h/c hair behind her ear, “Thank you. I love your movies. I’ve probably seen The Lake House almost a dozen times. I mean, your recent work is great too, amazing, but that one is my favorite.” She shifted her gaze down to her mug, embarrassed, “I’m sorry, you probably hear that kind of thing all the time.”

Keanu smiled wider, “No, its okay. Really.” He sipped his coffee. “Are you working on something new?” He gestured to her laptop and the little notepad that lay beside it. 

“Oh. Yeah.” Y/n glanced at her scribbled penmanship on the paper, “I am, sort of. Its new. I’m not really sure about it yet.”

“Well, whatever it is, I’m sure its going to be great.” She blushed again and thanked him for his confidence in her. After that, it didn’t take long to get past the awkwardness and they fell into easy conversation. They talked until they finished their drinks, then ordered others, then talked some more. Keanu’s warm and excitable personality drew her in and Y/n was refreshingly genuine and so much of an all round delight that he felt like he could spend the entire day with her. Of course, that was not possible as she informed him that she had a late lunch meeting with her editor. So, reluctantly, they parted ways after exchanging numbers and promises that they would meet again, this time on purpose, for a planned date.

summary: What Were You Thinking? (Keanu Reeves Imagine)
body:
What Were You Thinking? (Keanu Reeves Imagine)

This was requested.

Summary: You are starring in a new movie and fall for your co-star, Keanu Reeves. In order to impress him, you decide to do your own stunt for a particular scene. This idea does not go as planned.

You were on set for the latest action flick that you’d been cast in alongside Keanu Reeves. You couldn’t be more excited to be working alongside the legend. You were new to the business. You didn’t have a lot of work under your belt yet so you were grateful for the opportunity to be working on a highly anticipated film. You were playing Keanu’s younger sidekick in the movie so you had been spending a lot of time with the older gentleman. Enough time to make you fall for him. You were 26, which was pretty significant since the man was 54. You hadn’t meant to fall for him. It just sort of happened. Of course you never told him and he didn’t seem to notice. You didn’t expect him to go for someone as young as you anyways.

You were sat off to the side one particular day, sighing at the scene that was displayed before you. Keanu was chatting with one of the female workers on set. You had noticed him talking with her a lot. She was someone who was closer to his age and she was gorgeous so of course you felt threatened by her. You frowned when you noticed her touch his arm, resulting in a wide smile from Keanu. You certainly hadn’t ever made the man smile like that before. You were frustrated. How were you supposed to make the man notice when she was always around?

You sat there and though for a few moments before it finally hit you. Keanu was very much into all of the stunts that happened in movies. He performed a lot of his own. The scene you were to be in that day called for some stunts. There was a stunt double in place for you, but you decided to perform it yourself. You’d trained for it, but ultimately had to have a stunt double because you couldn’t land the stunt just right. You were determined to do it though.

“Hey, you doing okay?” Someone asked you.

You shook the thoughts from your head and looked up, finding Keanu stood there. He looked a bit concerned at you so you put on a reassuring smile for him.

“I’m doing alright,” you told him. “I was actually just thinking…I’d like to do my own stunt today.”

Keanu’s brow raised at that as he look at you, questioningly. “Are you sure, Y/N? It’s a hard one and you were struggling with it back in training.”

“I’m sure I can handle it,” you told Keanu, feeling a bit annoyed that he didn’t believe in you. “It’s not that hard.”

He was about to say something, but the director came over and interrupted him. He informed you that he was ready for you so you nodded and stood up. Keanu watched you as you walked off before he followed along with you two. You talked with the director about performing your own stunt. He talked it over with you and made sure you were willing to do it before he approved it.

“Y/N, are you sure about this?” Keanu asked you once the director had walked away.

“Yes, I’m sure,” you told him.

He didn’t say anything else. You were eventually told to take your mark so you walked up to your place as the stunt coordinator talked with you about what you were about to do. You listened to him carefully and made sure to take his advice. He was the one who had trained you and he was good. All you had to do was jump from the balcony and land on the huge table below just right. Of course there were mats and things around as a percausion. You weren’t too nervous about it.

“Alright, quiet on the set!” The director called out and everyone became silent. “Action!”

You looked over the balcony like the script had called for you too before you hopped up on the ledge of it. You were starting to feel a little iffy about this. There was no going back now though. You took a deep breath and jumped off of the balcony.

You didn’t land how you were supposed to though.

You landed on the table alright, but you ended up twisting your wrist when you used your hands to brace yourself. You yelped out in pain as you grabbed your injured wrist and held it close to yourself.

“Cut! The director yelled. “Y/N, are you okay?”

“I twisted my wrist when I landed,” you told him as you moved off of the table.

The dorector, the stunt coordinator, and Keanu all came over to check on you. It didn’t seem to be broken, but the director told you to go see the medic as a precaution. He also told you they would be using the stunt double for the scene. You sighed and nodded before Keanu lead you off set. The medic ended up checking you out in your trailer with Keanu there as well. Your wrist wasn’t broken, thankfully, but it was mildly sprained. You would have to take it easy on it. He wrapped it up for you and you thanked him before he left.

You and Keanu were left alone. You were so embarrassed by what had just happened. You didnall of that to impress him and totally screwed it up. So much for that plan. It was a stupid one anyways. You didn’t know what made you think it was such a good idea.

“Y/N, what were you thinking?” Keanu finally asked. “You knew you couldn’t do that and you still did it. You could’ve been hurt worse that that.”

“I know that, Keanu,” you told him as you looked down at your wrist. “It was a stupid idea and I totally blew it. I know.”

“Why did you do it then?” He asked you.

“Because,” you replied and shrugged your shoulders.

“Because?” He said. “That’s it? Beacause? You can do better than that.”

“Because I thought it might impress you,” you finally told him and mentally facepalmed yourself.

Keanu was quiet after that. He looked shocked by the admission. You felt like jumping out of a window. Not only have you embarrassed yourself trying to perform a stunt, but you just admitted your feelings to him. Trying to fucking impress him. You sounded like a school girl.

“What?” He finally asked and you sighed.

May as well come out with it.

“I performed the stunt because I thought it might impress you because I like you, Keanu. I’ve developed feelings for you while we’ve been filming this movie together. I thought that might impress you and make you see me differently. Fuck, I don’t know. I was just being stupid.”

You felt like running out of there, but it was your trailer, your sanctuary. He should just leave and put you out of your misery. You had embarrassed yourself enough. He didn’t leave though. Instead, he sat down beside you on the couch and sighed. You couldn’t even look at him.

“Y/N, you’re an amazing woman, but-”

“And here we go,” you sighed as you dropped your face in your uninsured hand.

“No, listen to me,” he told you and made you look at him. “You’re an amazing woman. You’re beautiful, talented, kind, amazing…but you’re too young for me.”

You frowned at that. “I’m 26, Keanu. Way past the legal age.”

“And I’m 54,” he replied. “That’s quite the age gap. You still have so much ahead of you and you’re in your prime while I’ve already been past mine. You deserve someone who’s still in their prime too. Someone that you can relate to and have fun with.”

“But I relate to you,” you told him. “We are such a great team.”

“Yes, but as friends,” he said with a small smile. “It just wouldn’t work with us and I know that deep down you know that. Maybe if I were younger…but the world doesn’t work like that. I’m sorry.”

You felt your eyes begin to tear up and tried to hold the tears back, but a few fell. You wiped them away quickly before you nodded and looked at Keanu.

“Yeah, I guess you’re right.”

Keanu smiled sadly at you and took your ininjured hand in his, squeezing it. “I would very much like for us to stay friends though. I consider myself lucky to have a friend like you.”

You smiled a bit and nodded at Keanu. “Yeah, of course. I’d like for us to stay friends. I’m sorry.”

“Don’t apologize, Y/N,” he told you. “There’s nothing to be sorry for.” He stayed there for a bit longer before he stood up and let go of your hand. “I should probably head back out there. Are you okay?”

You nodded and put on a smile for him. “Yeah, I’m okay.”

Keanu looked at you for a moment longer before he turned away and walked out of your trailer. When he shut the door, you cried some more. You knew he was right, but it still hurt. You would eventually move on, however. Besides, at least you could still stay friends with him because he was an amazing friend.
body_abstract:
What Were You Thinking? (Keanu Reeves Imagine)

This was requested.

Summary: You are starring in a new movie and fall for your co-star, Keanu Reeves. In order to impress him, you decide to do your own stunt for a particular scene. This idea does not go as planned.

reblog.comment:
What Were You Thinking? (Keanu Reeves Imagine)

This was requested.

Summary: You are starring in a new movie and fall for your co-star, Keanu Reeves. In order to impress him, you decide to do your own stunt for a particular scene. This idea does not go as planned.

[[MORE]]

You were on set for the latest action flick that you’d been cast in alongside Keanu Reeves. You couldn’t be more excited to be working alongside the legend. You were new to the business. You didn’t have a lot of work under your belt yet so you were grateful for the opportunity to be working on a highly anticipated film. You were playing Keanu’s younger sidekick in the movie so you had been spending a lot of time with the older gentleman. Enough time to make you fall for him. You were 26, which was pretty significant since the man was 54. You hadn’t meant to fall for him. It just sort of happened. Of course you never told him and he didn’t seem to notice. You didn’t expect him to go for someone as young as you anyways.

You were sat off to the side one particular day, sighing at the scene that was displayed before you. Keanu was chatting with one of the female workers on set. You had noticed him talking with her a lot. She was someone who was closer to his age and she was gorgeous so of course you felt threatened by her. You frowned when you noticed her touch his arm, resulting in a wide smile from Keanu. You certainly hadn’t ever made the man smile like that before. You were frustrated. How were you supposed to make the man notice when she was always around?

You sat there and though for a few moments before it finally hit you. Keanu was very much into all of the stunts that happened in movies. He performed a lot of his own. The scene you were to be in that day called for some stunts. There was a stunt double in place for you, but you decided to perform it yourself. You’d trained for it, but ultimately had to have a stunt double because you couldn’t land the stunt just right. You were determined to do it though.

“Hey, you doing okay?” Someone asked you.

You shook the thoughts from your head and looked up, finding Keanu stood there. He looked a bit concerned at you so you put on a reassuring smile for him.

“I’m doing alright,” you told him. “I was actually just thinking…I’d like to do my own stunt today.”

Keanu’s brow raised at that as he look at you, questioningly. “Are you sure, Y/N? It’s a hard one and you were struggling with it back in training.”

“I’m sure I can handle it,” you told Keanu, feeling a bit annoyed that he didn’t believe in you. “It’s not that hard.”

He was about to say something, but the director came over and interrupted him. He informed you that he was ready for you so you nodded and stood up. Keanu watched you as you walked off before he followed along with you two. You talked with the director about performing your own stunt. He talked it over with you and made sure you were willing to do it before he approved it.

“Y/N, are you sure about this?” Keanu asked you once the director had walked away.

“Yes, I’m sure,” you told him.

He didn’t say anything else. You were eventually told to take your mark so you walked up to your place as the stunt coordinator talked with you about what you were about to do. You listened to him carefully and made sure to take his advice. He was the one who had trained you and he was good. All you had to do was jump from the balcony and land on the huge table below just right. Of course there were mats and things around as a percausion. You weren’t too nervous about it.

“Alright, quiet on the set!” The director called out and everyone became silent. “Action!”

You looked over the balcony like the script had called for you too before you hopped up on the ledge of it. You were starting to feel a little iffy about this. There was no going back now though. You took a deep breath and jumped off of the balcony.

You didn’t land how you were supposed to though.

You landed on the table alright, but you ended up twisting your wrist when you used your hands to brace yourself. You yelped out in pain as you grabbed your injured wrist and held it close to yourself.

“Cut! The director yelled. “Y/N, are you okay?”

“I twisted my wrist when I landed,” you told him as you moved off of the table.

The dorector, the stunt coordinator, and Keanu all came over to check on you. It didn’t seem to be broken, but the director told you to go see the medic as a precaution. He also told you they would be using the stunt double for the scene. You sighed and nodded before Keanu lead you off set. The medic ended up checking you out in your trailer with Keanu there as well. Your wrist wasn’t broken, thankfully, but it was mildly sprained. You would have to take it easy on it. He wrapped it up for you and you thanked him before he left.

You and Keanu were left alone. You were so embarrassed by what had just happened. You didnall of that to impress him and totally screwed it up. So much for that plan. It was a stupid one anyways. You didn’t know what made you think it was such a good idea.

“Y/N, what were you thinking?” Keanu finally asked. “You knew you couldn’t do that and you still did it. You could’ve been hurt worse that that.”

“I know that, Keanu,” you told him as you looked down at your wrist. “It was a stupid idea and I totally blew it. I know.”

“Why did you do it then?” He asked you.

“Because,” you replied and shrugged your shoulders.

“Because?” He said. “That’s it? Beacause? You can do better than that.”

“Because I thought it might impress you,” you finally told him and mentally facepalmed yourself.

Keanu was quiet after that. He looked shocked by the admission. You felt like jumping out of a window. Not only have you embarrassed yourself trying to perform a stunt, but you just admitted your feelings to him. Trying to fucking impress him. You sounded like a school girl.

“What?” He finally asked and you sighed.

May as well come out with it.

“I performed the stunt because I thought it might impress you because I like you, Keanu. I’ve developed feelings for you while we’ve been filming this movie together. I thought that might impress you and make you see me differently. Fuck, I don’t know. I was just being stupid.”

You felt like running out of there, but it was your trailer, your sanctuary. He should just leave and put you out of your misery. You had embarrassed yourself enough. He didn’t leave though. Instead, he sat down beside you on the couch and sighed. You couldn’t even look at him.

“Y/N, you’re an amazing woman, but-”

“And here we go,” you sighed as you dropped your face in your uninsured hand.

“No, listen to me,” he told you and made you look at him. “You’re an amazing woman. You’re beautiful, talented, kind, amazing…but you’re too young for me.”

You frowned at that. “I’m 26, Keanu. Way past the legal age.”

“And I’m 54,” he replied. “That’s quite the age gap. You still have so much ahead of you and you’re in your prime while I’ve already been past mine. You deserve someone who’s still in their prime too. Someone that you can relate to and have fun with.”

“But I relate to you,” you told him. “We are such a great team.”

“Yes, but as friends,” he said with a small smile. “It just wouldn’t work with us and I know that deep down you know that. Maybe if I were younger…but the world doesn’t work like that. I’m sorry.”

You felt your eyes begin to tear up and tried to hold the tears back, but a few fell. You wiped them away quickly before you nodded and looked at Keanu.

“Yeah, I guess you’re right.”

Keanu smiled sadly at you and took your ininjured hand in his, squeezing it. “I would very much like for us to stay friends though. I consider myself lucky to have a friend like you.”

You smiled a bit and nodded at Keanu. “Yeah, of course. I’d like for us to stay friends. I’m sorry.”

“Don’t apologize, Y/N,” he told you. “There’s nothing to be sorry for.” He stayed there for a bit longer before he stood up and let go of your hand. “I should probably head back out there. Are you okay?”

You nodded and put on a smile for him. “Yeah, I’m okay.”

Keanu looked at you for a moment longer before he turned away and walked out of your trailer. When he shut the door, you cried some more. You knew he was right, but it still hurt. You would eventually move on, however. Besides, at least you could still stay friends with him because he was an amazing friend.
